title: Guitar Masters 07 of 16 Bensusan, De Grassi, Finger, Graham
description:
Guitar Masters 07 of 16 Bensusan, De Grassi, Finger, Graham

Still today people ask me about the old guitar torrents that I shared years ago at my first times at the Bay.
They often tell me that is difficult to find them all, cause the TPB search engine sucks, cause their trackers are dead and they seem deserted.
So I've decided to reshare them all with a unifying pattern in the name of the torrent:

Guitar Masters

followed by a progressive number, so those who are interested can find them easily.
They deal primarily with fingerstyle, and the albums they contain are not generally easy to find... so dont expect overall 320 bitrates.
The founding criterion here is to find and remember them as a document of great music of the past.

Enjoy :)

*****************************

PIERRE BENSUSAN

Pierre Bensusan is a French-Algerian guitarist. 
The genre of his acoustic guitar music is often characterized as Celtic, Folk, World music, New Age, or Chamber jazz.
He signed the contract for his first album, Pres de Paris, when he was just seventeen.
He has a reputation as something of an innovator in the field of solo acoustic guitar, including his use of the DADGAD tuning system, and his experimentation with electronics such as delays, distortions and volume pedals. 
   <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pierre_Bensusan" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pierre_Bensusan</a>   <a href="
http://www.pierrebensusan.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.pierrebensusan.com/</a>

What follows is a collection of some of his albums... Enjoy...

*****************************

ALEX DE GRASSI

Despite the italian name and the german look, Alex De Grassi is an american 
guitarist.
   <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alex_de_grassi" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alex_de_grassi</a>   <a href="
http://degrassi.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://degrassi.com/</a>

One of de Grassi's trademarks is his ability to create a highly orchestrated sound using his solo guitar and making a wide use of open tunings. Without overdubs, his playing weaves together melody, counter-melody, bass, harmony, rhythm, and cross-rhythms is such a way as to give the feeling of various instruments playing together. Using a broad palette of techniques and timbre, and driven by a unique sense of composition, his intricate guitar pieces begin to take the listener beyond the instrument into a complex tapestry of sound.

What follows is a collection of his albums (mostly from the first part of his career). Preparing this torrent today, I read in the FAQ section of his site that some of these albums are unavailable in music stores (!).

So enjoy these "unexpected" rarities.

_____________________________

alex de grassi - 1978 - turning  turning back
alex de grassi - 1991 - deep at night
alex de grassi - 1992 - a windham hill retrospective
alex de grassi - 1998 - the water garden
alex de grassi - altiplano
alex de grassi - beyond the night sky
alex de grassi - clockwork
alex de grassi - slow circle
alex de grassi - southern exposure

PETER FINGER

Peter Finger is a german guitarist, also founder of the label Acoustic Guitar.
   <a href="
http://www.acousticguitar.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.acousticguitar.com/</a>
   <a href="
http://www.peter-finger.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.peter-finger.com/</a>

His music springs from the French atmospheres 'a la Debussy' with a strong use of chromatic scales...
His style mixes classic music, rock, jazz, blues, celtic in a unique manner...

[...] quand un poeme exquis amene les larmes au bord des yeux, ces larmes ne sont pas la preuve d'un exces de jouissances, elles sont bien plutot le temoignage d'une melanconie irritee, d'une postulation des nerfs, d'une nature exilee dans l'imparfait et qui voudrait s'emparer immediatement, sur cette terre meme, d'un paradis rÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©lÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©vÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©.
                              Charles Baudelaire "Notes nouvelles sur Edgar Poe" 

(when an exquisite poem brings one's eyes to the point of tears, those tears are not evidence of an excess of joy, they are witness far more to an exacerbated melancholy, a disposition of the nerves, a nature exiled among imperfect things, which would like to possess, without delay, a paradise revealed on this very same earth.)


Enjoy this collection of albums from his discography

*****************************

DAVEY GRAHAM

David Michael Gordon Graham, known as Davey Graham (originally Davy Graham), is a guitarist who is one of the most influential figures in the folk music revolution in the United Kingdom in the 1960s. He inspired many of the famous practitioners of the fingerstyle acoustic guitar, such as Bert Jansch, John Renbourn, Martin Carthy, Paul Simon and even Jimmy Page...
   <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Davey_Graham" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Davey_Graham</a>   <a href="
http://www.davygraham.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.davygraham.com/</a>
